citation.title: Genetic polymorphism of UDP-glucuronosyltransferase 2B7 (UGT2B7) at amino acid 268: ethnic diversity of alleles and potential clinical significance.

comment.text: UDP-glucuronosyltransferase (UGT) that catalyzes phase II biotransformation reactions in which lipophilic substrates are conjugated with glucuronic acid to increase the metabolite's water solubility, thereby facilitating excretion into either the urine or bile (PubMed:10702251, PubMed:15472229, PubMed:15470161, PubMed:18674515, PubMed:18719240, PubMed:19022937, PubMed:23288867, PubMed:23756265, PubMed:26220143, PubMed:17442341). Essential for the elimination and detoxification of drugs, xenobiotics and endogenous compounds (PubMed:15470161, PubMed:18674515, PubMed:23756265). Catalyzes the glucuronidation of endogenous steroid hormones such as androgens (epitestosterone, androsterone) and estrogens (estradiol, epiestradiol, estriol, catechol estrogens) (PubMed:2159463, PubMed:15472229, PubMed:18719240, PubMed:19022937, PubMed:23288867, PubMed:26220143, PubMed:17442341). Also regulates the levels of retinoic acid, a major metabolite of vitamin A involved in apoptosis, cellular growth and differentiation, and embryonic development (PubMed:10702251). Contributes to bile acid (BA) detoxification by catalyzing the glucuronidation of BA substrates, which are natural detergents for dietary lipids absorption (PubMed:23756265). Involved in the glucuronidation of the AGTR1 angiotensin receptor antagonist losartan, caderastan and zolarsatan, drugs which can inhibit the effect of angiotensin II (PubMed:18674515). Also metabolizes mycophenolate, an immunosuppressive agent (PubMed:15470161).

reaction.text: glucuronate acceptor + UDP-alpha-D-glucuronate = acceptor beta-D-glucuronoside + H(+) + UDP
mycophenolate + UDP-alpha-D-glucuronate = mycophenolic acid O-acyl-beta-D-glucuronide + UDP

kinetics.KM: 10 uM for 17beta-estradiol/estradiol (when assaying glucuronidation at position 17)
33 uM for the formation of 2-hydroxy-17beta-estradiol (when assaying glucuronidation at position 2)
33 uM for 2-hydroxy-17beta-estradiol (when assaying glucuronidation at position 3)
22 uM for 4-hydroxy-17beta-estradiol (when assaying glucuronidation at position 3)
10 uM for 4-hydroxy-17beta-estradiol (when assaying glucuronidation at position 4)
62 uM for 4-hydroxy-estrone (when assaying glucuronidation at position 4)
3.4 uM for 16alpha-hydroxyestrone (when assaying glucuronidation at position 16)
5.96 uM for 17beta-estradiol/estradiol (when assaying glucuronidation at position 17)
1.7 uM for epitestosterone (when assaying glucuronidation at position 17)
200 uM for mycophenolate (when assaying glucuronidation at position 6')
4.2 uM for calcitriol (when assaying glucuronidation at position 25)
kinetics.Vmax: 42 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 17beta-estradiol 17-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
14 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 2-hydroxy-17beta-estradiol 2-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
372 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 2-hydroxy-17beta-estradiol 3-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
48 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 4-hydroxy-17beta-estradiol 3-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
523 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 4-hydroxy-17beta-estradiol 4-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
872 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 4-hydroxy-estrone 4-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
190 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 16alpha-hydroxyestrone 16-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
590 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 17alpha-estradiol 17-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
631 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 17beta-estradiol 17-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
32.6 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 17alpha-estradiol 17-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
4.5 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 17beta-estradiol 17-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
1198 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 16alpha,17beta-estriol 16-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
2717 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 16beta,17beta-estriol 16-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
35.2 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 16alpha,17alpha-estriol 16-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
1537 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 16alpha,17alpha-estriol 17-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
337 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of epitestosterone 17-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
523 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of all-trans-retinoate 1-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
1709 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of 4-hydroxy-4-O-(beta-D-glucuronide)-all-trans-retinoate
220 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of mycophenolic acid O-acyl-glucuronide
16.1 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of losartan-N2-beta-D-glucuronide
1.4 pmol/min/mg enzyme for the formation of calcitriol 25-O-(beta-D-glucuronate)
kinetics.text: Some kinetic parameters were assessed using commercial enzymes, which may represent a mix of both active and inactive protein forms, and therefore modify the kinetic values.

comment.text: 2 alleles have been identified: UGT2B7*1 (His-268) and UGT2B7*2 (Tyr-268). The sequence shown is that of allele UGT2B7*2.

property.value: Expressed in intestine and 74 other tissues
